  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      <style>
        
  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }

          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.

          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.

            <div class="keyboard-help-section">
              <span></span><span class="help-title"><!---->Anywhere<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->/<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->focus on the issue search field<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->c<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->compose a new issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->s<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->star the current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->?<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->show this help dialog<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
        </div>
        <p>
          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.
        </p>
      </chops-dialog>
    <mr-keystrokes></mr-keystrokes>

    <mr-cue centered="" cueprefname="search_for_numbers" hidden=""></mr-cue>


          
      
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {

          }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>

        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">

        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1330887#c5">Comment 5<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Fri, Jun 3, 2022, 7:25 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1330887#c5">Comment 5<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Fri, Jun 3, 2022, 7:25 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        Could be, although there should be a check just before that ZapCodeObject invocation, see the code snippet [0]. What's also strange to me is that the UnprotectAndRegisterMemoryChunk invocation. This seems outside a GC, so I would expect that the page gets unprotected here. But somehow the Unprotect succeeds but then the ZapCodeObject fails. Could concurrent Sparkplug be involved here? Could be that then UnprotectAndRegisterMemoryChunk doesn't really unprotect the page, a concurrent thread protects it again just before ZapCodeObject.<span class="line"><!---->Could be, although there should be a check just before that ZapCodeObject invocation, see the code snippet [0]. What's also strange to me is that the UnprotectAndRegisterMemoryChunk invocation. This seems outside a GC, so I would expect that the page gets unprotected here. But somehow the Unprotect succeeds but then the ZapCodeObject fails. Could concurrent Sparkplug be involved here? Could be that then UnprotectAndRegisterMemoryChunk doesn't really unprotect the page, a concurrent thread protects it again just before ZapCodeObject.<!----></span><br><br>If the returned allocation pointer is invalid for some reason, I would suspect UnprotectAndRegisterMemoryChunk would fail already.<span class="line"><!---->If the returned allocation pointer is invalid for some reason, I would suspect UnprotectAndRegisterMemoryChunk would fail already.<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>  if (allocation.To(&object)) {<span class="line"><!---->  if (allocation.To(&amp;object)) {<!----></span><br>    if (AllocationType::kCode == type && !V8_ENABLE_THIRD_PARTY_HEAP_BOOL) {<span class="line"><!---->    if (AllocationType::kCode == type &amp;&amp; !V8_ENABLE_THIRD_PARTY_HEAP_BOOL) {<!----></span><br>      // Unprotect the memory chunk of the object if it was not unprotected<span class="line"><!---->      // Unprotect the memory chunk of the object if it was not unprotected<!----></span><br>      // already.<span class="line"><!---->      // already.<!----></span><br>      heap_->UnprotectAndRegisterMemoryChunk(<span class="line"><!---->      heap_-&gt;UnprotectAndRegisterMemoryChunk(<!----></span><br>          object, UnprotectMemoryOrigin::kMainThread);<span class="line"><!---->          object, UnprotectMemoryOrigin::kMainThread);<!----></span><br>      heap_->ZapCodeObject(object.address(), size_in_bytes);<span class="line"><!---->      heap_-&gt;ZapCodeObject(object.address(), size_in_bytes);<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>0: <span class="line"><!---->0: <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:v8/src/heap/heap-allocator-inl.h;l=137-143;drc=8d6a246c9be4f6b731dc7f6e680b7d5e13a512b5;bpv=1;bpt=1?q=HeapAllocator::AllocateRaw&ss=chromium<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:v8/src/heap/heap-allocator-inl.h;l=137-143;drc=8d6a246c9be4f6b731dc7f6e680b7d5e13a512b5;bpv=1;bpt=1?q=HeapAllocator::AllocateRaw&amp;ss=chromium"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:v8/src/heap/heap-allocator-inl.h;l=137-143;drc=8d6a246c9be4f6b731dc7f6e680b7d5e13a512b5;bpv=1;bpt=1?q=HeapAllocator::AllocateRaw&amp;ss=chromium<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Thanks! But I think you may have misunderstood what I mean. My doubt is, since the code object memory can be `raced` as unwritable by other threads, is it possible that this memory can be reused by realloc or mprotect again? Race conditions can occur in many cases as I understand unless the code page memory is used once and never used again.<span class="line"><!---->Thanks! But I think you may have misunderstood what I mean. My doubt is, since the code object memory can be `raced` as unwritable by other threads, is it possible that this memory can be reused by realloc or mprotect again? Race conditions can occur in many cases as I understand unless the code page memory is used once and never used again.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        </div>

        In this particular case because of a race the page could have been switched from RW to RX state too early and only in this "direction". <span class="line"><!---->In this particular case because of a race the page could have been switched from RW to RX state too early and only in this "direction". <!----></span><br>Other than that the memory management in that page works as expected - live objects stay alive, dead objects are collected by GC and other objects might be allocated in the page's free space, etc.<span class="line"><!---->Other than that the memory management in that page works as expected - live objects stay alive, dead objects are collected by GC and other objects might be allocated in the page's free space, etc.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>

        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

        <slot></slot>
      </button>

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement.

    <mr-issue-page issueclosed=""><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;

            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {

          }
        }
      </style>

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        mr-issue-details {

          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          flex-direction: column;
          margin: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
        }
        h3 {
          margin-top: 1em;
        }
        mr-description {
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        mr-edit-issue {
          margin-top: 40px;
        }
      </style>

        Could be, although there should be a check just before that ZapCodeObject invocation, see the code snippet [0]. What's also strange to me is that the UnprotectAndRegisterMemoryChunk invocation. This seems outside a GC, so I would expect that the page gets unprotected here. But somehow the Unprotect succeeds but then the ZapCodeObject fails. Could concurrent Sparkplug be involved here? Could be that then UnprotectAndRegisterMemoryChunk doesn't really unprotect the page, a concurrent thread protects it again just before ZapCodeObject.<span class="line"><!---->Could be, although there should be a check just before that ZapCodeObject invocation, see the code snippet [0]. What's also strange to me is that the UnprotectAndRegisterMemoryChunk invocation. This seems outside a GC, so I would expect that the page gets unprotected here. But somehow the Unprotect succeeds but then the ZapCodeObject fails. Could concurrent Sparkplug be involved here? Could be that then UnprotectAndRegisterMemoryChunk doesn't really unprotect the page, a concurrent thread protects it again just before ZapCodeObject.<!----></span><br><br>If the returned allocation pointer is invalid for some reason, I would suspect UnprotectAndRegisterMemoryChunk would fail already.<span class="line"><!---->If the returned allocation pointer is invalid for some reason, I would suspect UnprotectAndRegisterMemoryChunk would fail already.<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>  if (allocation.To(&object)) {<span class="line"><!---->  if (allocation.To(&amp;object)) {<!----></span><br>    if (AllocationType::kCode == type && !V8_ENABLE_THIRD_PARTY_HEAP_BOOL) {<span class="line"><!---->    if (AllocationType::kCode == type &amp;&amp; !V8_ENABLE_THIRD_PARTY_HEAP_BOOL) {<!----></span><br>      // Unprotect the memory chunk of the object if it was not unprotected<span class="line"><!---->      // Unprotect the memory chunk of the object if it was not unprotected<!----></span><br>      // already.<span class="line"><!---->      // already.<!----></span><br>      heap_->UnprotectAndRegisterMemoryChunk(<span class="line"><!---->      heap_-&gt;UnprotectAndRegisterMemoryChunk(<!----></span><br>          object, UnprotectMemoryOrigin::kMainThread);<span class="line"><!---->          object, UnprotectMemoryOrigin::kMainThread);<!----></span><br>      heap_->ZapCodeObject(object.address(), size_in_bytes);<span class="line"><!---->      heap_-&gt;ZapCodeObject(object.address(), size_in_bytes);<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>0: <span class="line"><!---->0: <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:v8/src/heap/heap-allocator-inl.h;l=137-143;drc=8d6a246c9be4f6b731dc7f6e680b7d5e13a512b5;bpv=1;bpt=1?q=HeapAllocator::AllocateRaw&ss=chromium<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:v8/src/heap/heap-allocator-inl.h;l=137-143;drc=8d6a246c9be4f6b731dc7f6e680b7d5e13a512b5;bpv=1;bpt=1?q=HeapAllocator::AllocateRaw&amp;ss=chromium"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:v8/src/heap/heap-allocator-inl.h;l=137-143;drc=8d6a246c9be4f6b731dc7f6e680b7d5e13a512b5;bpv=1;bpt=1?q=HeapAllocator::AllocateRaw&amp;ss=chromium<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Thanks! But I think you may have misunderstood what I mean. My doubt is, since the code object memory can be `raced` as unwritable by other threads, is it possible that this memory can be reused by realloc or mprotect again? Race conditions can occur in many cases as I understand unless the code page memory is used once and never used again.<span class="line"><!---->Thanks! But I think you may have misunderstood what I mean. My doubt is, since the code object memory can be `raced` as unwritable by other threads, is it possible that this memory can be reused by realloc or mprotect again? Race conditions can occur in many cases as I understand unless the code page memory is used once and never used again.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        In this particular case because of a race the page could have been switched from RW to RX state too early and only in this "direction". <span class="line"><!---->In this particular case because of a race the page could have been switched from RW to RX state too early and only in this "direction". <!----></span><br>Other than that the memory management in that page works as expected - live objects stay alive, dead objects are collected by GC and other objects might be allocated in the page's free space, etc.<span class="line"><!---->Other than that the memory management in that page works as expected - live objects stay alive, dead objects are collected by GC and other objects might be allocated in the page's free space, etc.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

This information is moved from Heap into LocalHeap.<!----></span><br><br>We can't use kMaxWriteUnprotectCounter on the unprotect counter on the<span class="line"><!---->We can't use kMaxWriteUnprotectCounter on the unprotect counter on the<!----></span><br>MemoryChunk anymore, since e.g. for concurrent Sparkplug N threads might<span class="line"><!---->MemoryChunk anymore, since e.g. for concurrent Sparkplug N threads might<!----></span><br>now allocate a code object on the same page and since<span class="line"><!---->now allocate a code object on the same page and since<!----></span><br>CodePageCollectionMemoryModificationScope doesn't know about the<span class="line"><!---->CodePageCollectionMemoryModificationScope doesn't know about the<!----></span><br>other threads anymore, each thread has to increase that counter by 1.<span class="line"><!---->other threads anymore, each thread has to increase that counter by 1.<!----></span><br>We DCHECK that nesting depth now in the scope's constructor instead.<span class="line"><!---->We DCHECK that nesting depth now in the scope's constructor instead.<!----></span><br><br>We still need to remove chunks from `unprotected_memory_chunks_` when<span class="line"><!---->We still need to remove chunks from `unprotected_memory_chunks_` when<!----></span><br>freeing an executable MemoryChunk during GC. Fortunately we can still do<span class="line"><!---->freeing an executable MemoryChunk during GC. Fortunately we can still do<!----></span><br>this, since all threads are in a safepoint during GC and we can remove<span class="line"><!---->this, since all threads are in a safepoint during GC and we can remove<!----></span><br>the chunk from each thread-local set without any synchronization.<span class="line"><!---->the chunk from each thread-local set without any synchronization.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: chromium:1330887<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1330887" title="Security:  Illegal memory access in         for LitElement.

        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }

          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;

        for LitElement.

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>

      -------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b><br><br>VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>This is a crash found by fuzzer which I have not been able to reproduce successfully. But after reverse d8, I recovered most of the call stack information. Hope it helps.<span class="line"><!---->This is a crash found by fuzzer which I have not been able to reproduce successfully.         Hey GC team, does this call stack ring any bells?           <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1330887#c5">Comment 5<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Fri, Jun 3, 2022, 7:25 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>

        Could be, although there should be a check just before that ZapCodeObject invocation, see the code snippet [0]. What's also strange to me is that the UnprotectAndRegisterMemoryChunk invocation. This seems outside a GC, so I would expect that the page gets unprotected here. But somehow the Unprotect succeeds but then the ZapCodeObject fails. Could concurrent Sparkplug be involved here? Could be that then UnprotectAndRegisterMemoryChunk doesn't really unprotect the page, a concurrent thread protects it again just before ZapCodeObject.<span class="line"><!---->Could be, although there should be a check just before that ZapCodeObject invocation, see the code snippet [0]. What's also strange to me is that the UnprotectAndRegisterMemoryChunk invocation. This seems outside a GC, so I would expect that the page gets unprotected here. But somehow the Unprotect succeeds but then the ZapCodeObject fails. Could concurrent Sparkplug be involved here? Could be that then UnprotectAndRegisterMemoryChunk doesn't really unprotect the page, a concurrent thread protects it again just before ZapCodeObject.<!----></span><br><br>If the returned allocation pointer is invalid for some reason, I would suspect UnprotectAndRegisterMemoryChunk would fail already.<span class="line"><!---->If the returned allocation pointer is invalid for some reason, I would suspect UnprotectAndRegisterMemoryChunk would fail already.<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>  if (allocation.To(&object)) {<span class="line"><!---->  if (allocation.To(&amp;object)) {<!----></span><br>    if (AllocationType::kCode == type && !V8_ENABLE_THIRD_PARTY_HEAP_BOOL) {<span class="line"><!---->    if (AllocationType::kCode == type &amp;&amp; !V8_ENABLE_THIRD_PARTY_HEAP_BOOL) {<!----></span><br>      // Unprotect the memory chunk of the object if it was not unprotected<span class="line"><!---->      // Unprotect the memory chunk of the object if it was not unprotected<!----></span><br>      // already.<span class="line"><!---->      // already.<!----></span><br>      heap_->UnprotectAndRegisterMemoryChunk(<span class="line"><!---->      heap_-&gt;UnprotectAndRegisterMemoryChunk(<!----></span><br>          object, UnprotectMemoryOrigin::kMainThread);<span class="line"><!---->          object, UnprotectMemoryOrigin::kMainThread);<!----></span><br>      heap_->ZapCodeObject(object.address(), size_in_bytes);<span class="line"><!---->      heap_-&gt;ZapCodeObject(object.address(), size_in_bytes);<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>0: <span class="line"><!---->0: <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:v8/src/heap/heap-allocator-inl.h;l=137-143;drc=8d6a246c9be4f6b731dc7f6e680b7d5e13a512b5;bpv=1;bpt=1?q=HeapAllocator::AllocateRaw&ss=chromium<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:v8/src/heap/heap-allocator-inl.h;l=137-143;drc=8d6a246c9be4f6b731dc7f6e680b7d5e13a512b5;bpv=1;bpt=1?q=HeapAllocator::AllocateRaw&amp;ss=chromium"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:v8/src/heap/heap-allocator-inl.h;l=137-143;drc=8d6a246c9be4f6b731dc7f6e680b7d5e13a512b5;bpv=1;bpt=1?q=HeapAllocator::AllocateRaw&amp;ss=chromium<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Thank you very much for the great work! BTW, I have a question, is there any possibility that the non-writable code page memory be used by other threads, for example to modify permissions?<span class="line"><!---->Thank you very much for the great work! BTW, I have a question, is there any possibility that the non-writable code page memory be used by other threads, for example to modify permissions?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        Thanks! But I think you may have misunderstood what I mean. My doubt is, since the code object memory can be `raced` as unwritable by other threads, is it possible that this memory can be reused by realloc or mprotect again? Race conditions can occur in many cases as I understand unless the code page memory is used once and never used again.<span class="line"><!---->Thanks! But I think you may have misunderstood what I mean. My doubt is, since the code object memory can be `raced` as unwritable by other threads, is it possible that this memory can be reused by realloc or mprotect again? Race conditions can occur in many cases as I understand unless the code page memory is used once and never used again.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        In this particular case because of a race the page could have been switched from RW to RX state too early and only in this "direction". <span class="line"><!---->In this particular case because of a race the page could have been switched from RW to RX state too early and only in this "direction". <!----></span><br>Other than that the memory management in that page works as expected - live objects stay alive, dead objects are collected by GC and other objects might be allocated in the page's free space, etc.<span class="line"><!---->Other than that the memory management in that page works as expected - live objects stay alive, dead objects are collected by GC and other objects might be allocated in the page's free space, etc.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/v8/v8/+/a537be463f2d89f5c8165041a05fbf6663b9f195<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/v8/v8/+/a537be463f2d89f5c8165041a05fbf6663b9f195"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/v8/v8/+/a537be463f2d89f5c8165041a05fbf6663b9f195<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>a537be463f2d89f5c8165041a05fbf6663b9f195<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/a537be463f2d89f5c8165041a05fbf6663b9f195"><!---->a537be463f2d89f5c8165041a05fbf6663b9f195<!----></a><br>Author: Dominik Inführ <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Dominik Inführ &lt;<!----></span>dinfuehr@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/dinfuehr@chromium.org"><!---->dinfuehr@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Thu Jun 09 14:01:39 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Thu Jun 09 14:01:39 2022<!----></span><br><br>[heap] Track unprotected chunks in LocalHeap<span class="line"><!---->[heap] Track unprotected chunks in LocalHeap<!----></span><br><br>CodePageCollectionMemoryModificationScope now increases a per-thread<span class="line"><!---->CodePageCollectionMemoryModificationScope now increases a per-thread<!----></span><br>counter and inserts unprotected code chunks into a thread-local set<span class="line"><!---->counter and inserts unprotected code chunks into a thread-local set<!----></span><br>of chunks. This information is moved from Heap into LocalHeap.<span class="line"><!---->of chunks. This information is moved from Heap into LocalHeap.<!----></span><br><br>We can't use kMaxWriteUnprotectCounter on the unprotect counter on the<span class="line"><!---->We can't use kMaxWriteUnprotectCounter on the unprotect counter on the<!----></span><br>MemoryChunk anymore, since e.g. for concurrent Sparkplug N threads might<span class="line"><!---->MemoryChunk anymore, since e.g. for concurrent Sparkplug N threads might<!----></span><br>now allocate a code object on the same page and since<span class="line"><!---->now allocate a code object on the same page and since<!----></span><br>CodePageCollectionMemoryModificationScope doesn't know about the<span class="line"><!---->CodePageCollectionMemoryModificationScope doesn't know about the<!----></span><br>other threads anymore, each thread has to increase that counter by 1.<span class="line"><!---->other threads anymore, each thread has to increase that counter by 1.<!----></span><br>We DCHECK that nesting depth now in the scope's constructor instead.<span class="line"><!---->We DCHECK that nesting depth now in the scope's constructor instead.<!----></span><br><br>We still need to remove chunks from `unprotected_memory_chunks_` when<span class="line"><!---->We still need to remove chunks from `unprotected_memory_chunks_` when<!----></span><br>freeing an executable MemoryChunk during GC. Fortunately we can still do<span class="line"><!---->freeing an executable MemoryChunk during GC. Fortunately we can still do<!----></span><br>this, since all threads are in a safepoint during GC and we can remove<span class="line"><!---->this, since all threads are in a safepoint during GC and we can remove<!----></span><br>the chunk from each thread-local set without any synchronization.<span class="line"><!---->the chunk from each thread-local set without any synchronization.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: chromium:1330887<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1330887" title="Security:  Illegal memory access in v8::internal::Heap::ZapCodeObject"><!---->Bug: chromium:1330887<!----></a><br>Change-Id: Icefc61b8d8de113d8dcfb1cf64122d12dd9798c4<span class="line"><!---->Change-Id: Icefc61b8d8de113d8dcfb1cf64122d12dd9798c4<!----></span><br>Reviewed-on: <span class="line"><!---->Reviewed-on: <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/v8/v8/+/3688516<a       -------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b><br><br>VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>This is a crash found by fuzzer which I have not been able to reproduce successfully. But after reverse d8, I recovered most of the call stack information. Hope it helps.<span class="line"><!---->This is a crash found by fuzzer which I have not been able to reproduce successfully. But after reverse d8, I recovered most of the call stack information. Hope it helps.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>v8 hash: <span class="line"><!---->v8 hash: <!----></span>bdb20626c106aa144ab06b624990dd8dccb085bc<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/bdb20626c106aa144ab06b624990dd8dccb085bc"><!---->bdb20626c106aa144ab06b624990dd8dccb085bc<!----></a><br>OS: Linux-X86<span class="line"><!---->OS: Linux-X86<!----></span><br>GN: is_debug = false<span class="line"><!---->GN: is_debug = false<!----></span><br>    dcheck_always_on = true<span class="line"><!---->    dcheck_always_on = true<!----></span><br>    v8_static_library = true<span class="line"><!---->    v8_static_library = true<!----></span><br>    v8_enable_slow_dchecks = true<span class="line"><!---->         Hey GC team, does this call stack ring any bells?         Could be, although there should be a check just before that ZapCodeObject invocation, see the code snippet [0]. What's also strange to me is that the UnprotectAndRegisterMemoryChunk invocation. This seems outside a GC, so I would expect that the page gets unprotected here. But somehow the Unprotect succeeds but then the ZapCodeObject fails. Could concurrent Sparkplug be involved here? Could be that then UnprotectAndRegisterMemoryChunk doesn't really unprotect the page, a concurrent thread protects it again just before ZapCodeObject.<span class="line"><!---->Could be, although there should be a check just before that ZapCodeObject invocation, see the code snippet [0]. What's also strange to me is that the UnprotectAndRegisterMemoryChunk invocation. This seems outside a GC, so I would expect that the page gets unprotected here. But somehow the Unprotect succeeds but then the ZapCodeObject fails. Could concurrent Sparkplug be involved here? Could be that then UnprotectAndRegisterMemoryChunk doesn't really unprotect the page, a concurrent thread protects it again just before ZapCodeObject.<!----></span><br><br>If the returned allocation pointer is invalid for some reason, I would suspect UnprotectAndRegisterMemoryChunk would fail already.<span class="line"><!---->If the returned allocation pointer is invalid for some reason, I would suspect UnprotectAndRegisterMemoryChunk would fail already.<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>  if (allocation.To(&object)) {<span class="line"><!---->  if (allocation.To(&amp;object)) {<!----></span><br>    if (AllocationType::kCode == type && !V8_ENABLE_THIRD_PARTY_HEAP_BOOL) {<span class="line"><!---->    if (AllocationType::kCode == type &amp;&amp; !V8_ENABLE_THIRD_PARTY_HEAP_BOOL) {<!----></span><br>      // Unprotect the memory chunk of the object if it was not unprotected<span class="line"><!---->      // Unprotect the memory chunk of the object if it was not unprotected<!----></span><br>      // already.<span class="line"><!---->      // already.<!----></span><br>      heap_->UnprotectAndRegisterMemoryChunk(<span class="line"><!---->      heap_-&gt;UnprotectAndRegisterMemoryChunk(<!----></span><br>          object, UnprotectMemoryOrigin::kMainThread);<span class="line"><!---->          object, UnprotectMemoryOrigin::kMainThread);<!----></span><br>      heap_->ZapCodeObject(object.address(), size_in_bytes);<span class="line"><!---->      heap_-&gt;ZapCodeObject(object.address(), size_in_bytes);<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>0: <span class="line"><!---->0: <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:v8/src/heap/heap-allocator-inl.h;l=137-143;drc=8d6a246c9be4f6b731dc7f6e680b7d5e13a512b5;bpv=1;bpt=1?q=HeapAllocator::AllocateRaw&ss=chromium<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:v8/src/heap/heap-allocator-inl.h;l=137-143;drc=8d6a246c9be4f6b731dc7f6e680b7d5e13a512b5;bpv=1;bpt=1?q=HeapAllocator::AllocateRaw&amp;ss=chromium"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:v8/src/heap/heap-allocator-inl.h;l=137-143;drc=8d6a246c9be4f6b731dc7f6e680b7d5e13a512b5;bpv=1;bpt=1?q=HeapAllocator::AllocateRaw&amp;ss=chromium<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Dear owner, thanks for fixing this bug. We’ve reopened it because security bugs need Security_Severity and FoundIn labels set, which will enable the bots to request merges to the correct branches ( as well as helping out our vulnerability reward and CVE processes). Please consult with any Chrome security contact (<span class="line"><!---->Dear owner, thanks for fixing this bug.         Thanks! But I think you may have misunderstood what I mean. My doubt is, since the code object memory can be `raced` as unwritable by other threads, is it possible that this memory can be reused by realloc or mprotect again? Race conditions can occur in many cases as I understand unless the code page memory is used once and never used again.<span class="line"><!---->Thanks! But I think you may have misunderstood what I mean. My doubt is, since the code object memory can be `raced` as unwritable by other threads, is it possible that this memory can be reused by realloc or mprotect again? Race conditions can occur in many cases as I understand unless the code page memory is used once and never used again.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        In this particular case because of a race the page could have been switched from RW to RX state too early and only in this "direction". <span class="line"><!---->In this particular case because of a race the page could have been switched from RW to RX state too early and only in this "direction". <!----></span><br>Other than that the memory management in that page works as expected - live objects stay alive, dead objects are collected by GC and other objects might be allocated in the page's free space, etc.<span class="line"><!---->Other than that the memory management in that page works as expected - live objects stay alive, dead objects are collected by GC and other objects might be allocated in the page's free space, etc.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

Fortunately we can still do<span class="line"><!---->freeing an executable MemoryChunk during GC.       -------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b><br><br>VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>This is a crash found by fuzzer which I have not been able to reproduce successfully. But after reverse d8, I recovered most of the call stack information. Hope it helps.<span class="line"><!---->This is a crash found by fuzzer which I have not been able to reproduce successfully.         Hey GC team, does this call stack ring any bells? My wild guess is that we probably hit some edge case of succeeding with allocation when we should have reported an OOM.<span class="line"><!---->Hey GC team, does this call stack ring any bells? My wild guess is that we probably hit some edge case of succeeding with allocation when we should have reported an OOM.<!----></span><br>I wasn't able to reproduce this crash - it fails with a regular OOM.<span class="line"><!---->I wasn't able to reproduce this crash - it fails with a regular OOM.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1330887#c5">Comment 5<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Fri, Jun 3, 2022, 7:25 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>

      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        Could be, although there should be a check just before that ZapCodeObject invocation, see the code snippet [0]. What's also strange to me is that the UnprotectAndRegisterMemoryChunk invocation. This seems outside a GC, so I would expect that the page gets unprotected here. But somehow the Unprotect succeeds but then the ZapCodeObject fails. Could concurrent Sparkplug be involved here? Could be that then UnprotectAndRegisterMemoryChunk doesn't really unprotect the page, a concurrent thread protects it again just before ZapCodeObject.<span class="line"><!---->Could be, although there should be a check just before that ZapCodeObject invocation, see the code snippet [0]. What's also strange to me is that the UnprotectAndRegisterMemoryChunk invocation. This seems outside a GC, so I would expect that the page gets unprotected here. But somehow the Unprotect succeeds but then the ZapCodeObject fails. Could concurrent Sparkplug be involved here? Could be that then UnprotectAndRegisterMemoryChunk doesn't really unprotect the page, a concurrent thread protects it again just before ZapCodeObject.<!----></span><br><br>If the returned allocation pointer is invalid for some reason, I would suspect UnprotectAndRegisterMemoryChunk would fail already.<span class="line"><!---->If the returned allocation pointer is invalid for some reason, I would suspect UnprotectAndRegisterMemoryChunk would fail already.<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>  if (allocation.To(&object)) {<span class="line"><!---->  if (allocation.To(&amp;object)) {<!----></span><br>    if (AllocationType::kCode == type && !V8_ENABLE_THIRD_PARTY_HEAP_BOOL) {<span class="line"><!---->    if (AllocationType::kCode == type &amp;&amp; !V8_ENABLE_THIRD_PARTY_HEAP_BOOL) {<!----></span><br>      // Unprotect the memory chunk of the object if it was not unprotected<span class="line"><!---->      // Unprotect the memory chunk of the object if it was not unprotected<!----></span><br>      // already.<span class="line"><!---->      // already.<!----></span><br>      heap_->UnprotectAndRegisterMemoryChunk(<span class="line"><!---->      heap_-&gt;UnprotectAndRegisterMemoryChunk(<!----></span><br>          object, UnprotectMemoryOrigin::kMainThread);<span class="line"><!---->          object, UnprotectMemoryOrigin::kMainThread);<!----></span><br>      heap_->ZapCodeObject(object.address(), size_in_bytes);<span class="line"><!---->      heap_-&gt;ZapCodeObject(object.address(), size_in_bytes);<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>0: <span class="line"><!---->0: <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:v8/src/heap/heap-allocator-inl.h;l=137-143;drc=8d6a246c9be4f6b731dc7f6e680b7d5e13a512b5;bpv=1;bpt=1?q=HeapAllocator::AllocateRaw&ss=chromium<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:v8/src/heap/heap-allocator-inl.h;l=137-143;drc=8d6a246c9be4f6b731dc7f6e680b7d5e13a512b5;bpv=1;bpt=1?q=HeapAllocator::AllocateRaw&amp;ss=chromium"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:v8/src/heap/heap-allocator-inl.h;l=137-143;drc=8d6a246c9be4f6b731dc7f6e680b7d5e13a512b5;bpv=1;bpt=1?q=HeapAllocator::AllocateRaw&amp;ss=chromium<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Dear owner, thanks for fixing this bug. We’ve reopened it because security bugs need Security_Severity and FoundIn labels set, which will enable the bots to request merges to the correct branches ( as well as helping out our vulnerability reward and CVE processes). Please consult with any Chrome security contact (<span class="line"><!---->Dear owner, thanks for fixing this bug.         Thanks! But I think you may have misunderstood what I mean. My doubt is, since the code object memory can be `raced` as unwritable by other threads, is it possible that this memory can be reused by realloc or mprotect again? Race conditions can occur in many cases as I understand unless the code page memory is used once and never used again.<span class="line"><!---->Thanks! But I think you may have misunderstood what I mean. My doubt is, since the code object memory can be `raced` as unwritable by other threads, is it possible that this memory can be reused by realloc or mprotect again? Race conditions can occur in many cases as I understand unless the code page memory is used once and never used again.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        In this particular case because of a race the page could have been switched from RW to RX state too early and only in this "direction". <span class="line"><!---->In this particular case because of a race the page could have been switched from RW to RX state too early and only in this "direction". <!----></span><br>Other than that the memory management in that page works as expected - live objects stay alive, dead objects are collected by GC and other objects might be allocated in the page's free space, etc.<span class="line"><!---->Other than that the memory management in that page works as expected - live objects stay alive, dead objects are collected by GC and other objects might be allocated in the page's free space, etc.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/v8/v8/+/a537be463f2d89f5c8165041a05fbf6663b9f195<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/v8/v8/+/a537be463f2d89f5c8165041a05fbf6663b9f195"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/v8/v8/+/a537be463f2d89f5c8165041a05fbf6663b9f195<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>a537be463f2d89f5c8165041a05fbf6663b9f195<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/a537be463f2d89f5c8165041a05fbf6663b9f195"><!---->a537be463f2d89f5c8165041a05fbf6663b9f195<!----></a><br>Author: Dominik Inführ <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Dominik Inführ &lt;<!----></span>dinfuehr@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/dinfuehr@chromium.org"><!---->dinfuehr@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Thu Jun 09 14:01:39 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Thu Jun 09 14:01:39 2022<!----></span><br><br>[heap] Track unprotected chunks in LocalHeap<span class="line"><!---->[heap] Track unprotected chunks in LocalHeap<!----></span><br><br>CodePageCollectionMemoryModificationScope now increases a per-thread<span class="line"><!---->CodePageCollectionMemoryModificationScope now increases a per-thread<!----></span><br>counter and inserts unprotected code chunks into a thread-local set<span class="line"><!---->counter and inserts unprotected code chunks into a thread-local set<!----></span><br>of chunks. This information is moved from Heap into LocalHeap.<span class="line"><!---->of chunks. This information is moved from Heap into LocalHeap.<!----></span><br><br>We can't use kMaxWriteUnprotectCounter on the unprotect counter on the<span class="line"><!---->We can't use kMaxWriteUnprotectCounter on the unprotect counter on the<!----></span><br>MemoryChunk anymore, since e.g. for concurrent Sparkplug N threads might<span class="line"><!---->MemoryChunk anymore, since e.g. for concurrent Sparkplug N threads might<!----></span><br>now allocate a code object on the same page and since<span class="line"><!---->now allocate a code object on the same page and since<!----></span><br>CodePageCollectionMemoryModificationScope doesn't know about the<span class="line"><!---->CodePageCollectionMemoryModificationScope doesn't know about the<!----></span><br>other threads anymore, each thread has to increase that counter by 1.<span class="line"><!---->other threads anymore, each thread has to increase that counter by 1.<!----></span><br>We DCHECK that nesting depth now in the scope's constructor instead.<span class="line"><!---->We DCHECK that nesting depth now in the scope's constructor instead.<!----></span><br><br>We still need to remove chunks from `unprotected_memory_chunks_` when<span class="line"><!---->We still need to remove chunks from `unprotected_memory_chunks_` when<!----></span><br>freeing an executable MemoryChunk during GC. Fortunately we can still do<span class="line"><!---->freeing an executable MemoryChunk during GC. Fortunately we can still do<!----></span><br>this, since all threads are in a safepoint during GC and we can remove<span class="line"><!---->this, since all threads are in a safepoint during GC and we can remove<!----></span><br>the chunk from each thread-local set without any synchronization.<span class="line"><!---->the chunk from each thread-local set without any synchronization.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: chromium:1330887<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1330887" title="Security:  Illegal memory access in           margin-top: 1em;
        }
        mr-description {
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        mr-edit-issue {
          margin-top: 40px;
        }
      </style>
